comment.author: 10626847@N00
comment._content: They are printing using what is called a web press> Rather than feeding sheets of paper, they use roll and cut the pages after printing. Newspapers are printed on news print paper so those rolls would be that paper. The process is called offset printing. The printing plate reads correctly and then rollers are used as the paper if fed through them to have the finished paper read correctly. The principal of printing is that water and ink (oily) do not mix.  The ink is offset onto the rollers, and they they are kept wet to stop the ink showing up in other places on the roller. The paper moves through the big offset pressers at high speed. Paper jams are a spectacular sight.
